channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Google Search Only Got Worse After the Death of "Googlewhacks"
item.dc:creator: Adam Davidson
item.description: The moment Google's search algorithm changed foreverâ€”and not for the better.
item.content:encoded: Google is far and away the most dominant search engine on the planet, with an enormous share of the search engine market. Just because Google search is dominant, however, doesn't mean it's necessarily good. In fact, the opposite is true; the quality of Google search has been getting worse and worse, and it's possible to identify the moment when it all went wrong.

item.title: 3 Neat Linux Apps to Try This Weekend (September 26 - 28)
item.dc:creator: Jordan Gloor
item.description: Ever wanted to check the weather in your terminal?
item.content:encoded: Just installed Linux on an old PC and want to know how to you can make the most of it? Or maybe you want to do more in the terminal? I've gathered some free and open source software for Linux that's worth an install this weekend.

item.title: This Open-Source Tool Let Me Install Windows 11 Without AI Features
item.dc:creator: Aman Kumar
item.content:encoded: AI is slowly becoming integral to many operating systems, including Windows. Copilot and Windows Recall are two of the main AI features available on Windows PCs. But what if you want your Windows computer to be free of these AI features? In that case, you can use Flyoobe to install Windows 11 without any AI components.

item.title: New Smartphone Company Just Dropped
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.description: Will it sell its phones in the US?
item.content:encoded: You'd be forgiven for not knowing it, but Nothing had a budget sub-brand, CMF, that sold a few budget-friendly products. It will now continue its life as an independent brand, so now we have a new smartphone company.

item.title: 5 Used Grand Tourers You Can Buy For the Price of a New Toyota Corolla
item.dc:creator: Brent vd Schyff
item.description: Discover the hidden gems of the used luxury car market. These 5 grand tourers offer opulence and performance at an unbelievable value.
item.content:encoded: Grand Tourers on a budget. The more I engage with that question, the more examples I find that could meet that need. (Most of these) cars were built strong in a time to meet strict quality requirements and were built to last. Sure, the clientele demanded high quality cars, but those same buyers have long since moved on. This abandonment means that there are quality-built GTs that still exist out there, some occupying second-hand dealer lots or having been traded in search of a new appreciative owner. One who will breathe new life into them. And in return, be rewarded with a few more years of enjoyment.

item.title: Amazon Might Have to Pay You Back for Tricking You
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: Amazon got in trouble with the FCC.
item.content:encoded: If you have ever accidentally signed up for Amazon Prime when checking out, or had a ridiculously hard time trying to cancel, you could be getting some money back soon. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is forcing Amazon to pay members back for the unnecessary difficulties with its memberships.

item.title: For $20, the Blink Mini 2 Indoor and Outdoor Smart Camera Is a Steal
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: A lot of features for not a lot of money.
item.content:encoded: The latest Blink Mini 2 security camera is now available for an impressive 50% discount. This excellent deal slashes the price to just $20 on Amazon, which is a massive drop from its usual $40 price tag. This low price gives you a new security camera with a built-in spotlight and color night vision.

item.title: The New Raspberry Pi 500+ Has a Built-in Mechanical Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: It's billed as "the ultimate Raspberry Pi all-in-one PC."
item.content:encoded: The Raspberry Pi 500 was the first Pi computer with an integrated keyboard, and now thereâ€™s an upgraded model to get excited about. The new Raspberry Pi 500+ has arrived with a higher-quality mechanical keyboard, better internal hardware, and all-important RGB lights.

item.title: Amazon's Fire OS Replacement for TVs Could Arrive Soon
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: A job listing confirmed it again.
item.content:encoded: Amazon is preparing to replace Android with its own custom-built Vega OS on Fire TV devices, and an accidental job posting for a software development manager for Prime Video just leaked it. We've been hearing rumors about this for a while, but it should arrive before the end of the year.

item.title: Anker Introduces Its Insanely Convenient Nebula X1 Pro Outdoor Projector
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heinzman
item.description: A rolling cart projector with wireless 7.1.4 surround sound speakers. Nice!
item.content:encoded: Anker is now offering the Nebula X1 Pro, a high-end rolling cart projector designed for indoor and outdoor venues with screens up to 300 inches. It costs $5,000 and is available for pre-order today.
